law.catch_line: Except as otherwise provided in this subtitle, a minor may not be employed or allowed to work:...

text.section:
The Commissioner may prohibit minors being employed in an occupation if:
after a public hearing, the Commissioner determines that employment in the occupation should be prohibited to minors;
the Commissioner adopts by reference a determination by the United States Secretary of Labor under the federal Fair Labor Standards Act of 1938 that the occupation is hazardous; or
after investigation, the Commissioner determines that the occupation is injurious to:
the health or welfare of minors; or
the morals of minors under the age of 16 years.
